name: PRINTCRAFT CARD COMPANY, INC. v. Ernest MEDWIG, Appellant, and National Engraving Company, Inc.

judges: Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
parties: PRINTCRAFT CARD COMPANY, INC. v. Ernest MEDWIG, Appellant, and National Engraving Company, Inc.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM.
The appeal herein is quashed. Costs on appellant.
MANDERINO, J., dissents.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: John L. Laubach, Jr., Henry W. Fulton, Jr., Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Edmund K. Trent, Gerald C. Paris, Reed, Smith, Shaw & McClay, Pittsburgh, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
344 A.2d 459
PRINTCRAFT CARD COMPANY, INC. v. Ernest MEDWIG, Appellant, and National Engraving Company, Inc.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 8, 1974.
Decided Oct. 3, 1975.
John L. Laubach, Jr., Henry W. Fulton, Jr., Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Edmund K. Trent, Gerald C. Paris, Reed, Smith, Shaw & McClay, Pittsburgh, for appellee.
Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
